Uses of Package
thobe.widgets.splitPanel

  • Packages that use thobe.widgets.splitPanel 
    Package Description
    thobe.widgets.splitPanel  
  • Classes in thobe.widgets.splitPanel used by thobe.widgets.splitPanel 
    Class and Description
    SPComponentDecorator
    Panel which can be placed into a SplitPanel (as even any other Component), but this one is decorated with some useful things like:
    a menubar with buttons for vertical-, horizontal-split, lock, close and maximize a WaitingDecorator that visualizes the enable/ disable status of the panel and its subcomponents a WaitingDecorator that can be used to visualize progress (spinning dial + progress bar) a user defined menu-bar (bottom) for user defined actions
    SPComponentDecoratorButtonType
    Enumeration representing the different buttons of the SPComponentDecorators top right menu-bar
    SPComponentDecoratorListener
    Interface representing a listener that can be used to listen for window-events (close, split, maximize) of the top menu-bar of the SPComponentDecorator.
    SPContent 
    SPContentFactory
    This interface has to be implemented if you want to use the SplitPanel.
    SPContentSwitch 
    SPContentSwitchListener 
    SPDivider
    A class representing the divider that separates two subframes of the SplitPanel from each other.
    SPDividerType
    An enum representing the type of an SPDivider.
    SPFrame
    Abstract class representing the component of the composite design-pattern.
    SPFrameContainer
    A class that represents the composite of the composite design-pattern.
    SPFrameContainerXML 
    SPFrameXML 
    SplitPanelListener 
    SPSubFrame
    A class that represents the leaf of the composite design-pattern.
    SPSubFrameEvent 
    SPSubFrameListener
    Interface that can be used to listen for events generated by the SPSubFrame (split, maximize, minimize, close, content switch).
    SPSubFrameXML 
    SPTreeException
    An Exception thrown on problems occurring in connection with the tree of the SplitPanel.
